definitions.text: to a severe or serious degree
examples: fingers so badly frozen they had to be amputated

definitions.text: (`ill' is often used as a combining form) in a poor or improper or unsatisfactory manner; not well
examples: it ill befits a man to betray old friends
he performed badly on the exam
to steal is to act badly

definitions.text: in a disobedient or naughty way
examples: he mischievously looked for a chance to embarrass his sister
behaved naughtily when they had guests and was sent to his room

definitions.text: with great intensity (`bad' is a nonstandard variant for `badly')

examples: I wanted it badly enough to work hard for it
they were badly in need of help
he wants a bicycle so bad he can taste it

definitions.text: without skill or in a displeasing manner
examples: I think he paints very badly

definitions.text: in a disadvantageous way; to someone's disadvantage
examples: the venture turned out badly for the investors
angry that the case was settled disadvantageously for them
tried not to speak ill of the dead
thought badly of him for his lack of concern

definitions.text: with unusual distress or resentment or regret or emotional display
examples: conducted himself very badly at the time of the earthquake
